c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (05:43): when I hit backspace when Im using aterm (only aterm has this issue) I get a ^? priinted instead of it working, if I issue :fix then backspace acts like del, how do I get it to act like it should?
299813521c8e0cb0572b9feea44f57d2 (05:44): errr: this is not a vi issue but an error in your terminal configuration.
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (05:45): ic56: ah ok, would you happen to know the fix for it?
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (05:46): ic56: I figured it was a vim issue since it only happens when Im using vim, normal shell operation works fine as do other cli editors
299813521c8e0cb0572b9feea44f57d2 (05:46): errr: read the stty manpage.   The right answer depends on what else is competing for your keyboard.  stty erase '^?'  will fix it for aterm
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (05:47): ic56: cool that got it, thanks
